publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5823 Bill Kidd: Bringing Glasgow and Donegal Closer Together—That the Parliament welcomes Aer Arann’s launch of a new direct service, starting on 28 March 2010, from Donegal Airport to Glasgow Airport, which will replace the current Donegal to Glasgow Prestwick route; commends Aer Arann’s decision to now offer the service four days a week, compared with three days a week at Glasgow Prestwick, which will help residents of Glasgow in commuting to Ireland both for work and leisure, and welcomes the positive impact that the new route will have on tourism in Glasgow, supporting and creating jobs and boosting Glasgow’s economy.

S3M-5823 Bill Kidd: Bringing Glasgow and Donegal Closer Together—That the Parliament welcomes Aer Arann’s launch of a new direct service, starting on 28 March 2010, from Donegal Airport to Glasgow Airport, which will replace the current Donegal to Glasgow Prestwick route; commends Aer Arann’s decision to now offer the service four days a week, compared with three days a week at Glasgow Prestwick, which will help residents of Glasgow in commuting to Ireland both for work and leisure, and welcomes the positive impact that the new route will have on tourism in Glasgow, supporting and creating jobs and boosting Glasgow’s economy.
S3M-5823 Bringing Glasgow and Donegal Closer Together (lodged on 25 February 2010) Mary Scanlon*
